. Foxes and cats are covered in hair
questionsData.explain_answer:
False.

Foxes and cats are covered in fur.

الثعالب والقطط مغطاة بالفرو.

الفرو: هو المصطلح الذي يُستخدم عادة للإشارة إلى الشعر الكثيف الطويل الذي يغطي أجسام بعض الحيوانات، مثل الثعالب والقطط والدببة.
الفرو عادة ما يكون أكثر كثافة وطولاً من الشعر الذي ينمو على جسم الانسان .

? In which type of eclipses the Sun is covered completely
questionsData.article: A solar eclipse occurs when the Moon moves in front of the Sun and hides at least some part of the Sun from the Earth. In a partial eclipse, the Moon covers part of the Sun. In an annular eclipse, the Moon covers the center of the Sun, leaving a bright ring of light around the Moon. In a total eclipse, the Sun is completely covered by the Moon. It seems rather improbable that a celestial body the size of the Moon could completely block out the tremendously immense Sun, as happens during a total eclipse, but this is exactly what happens. Although the Moon is considerably smaller in size than the Sun, the Moon is able to cover the Sun because of their relative distances from the Earth. A total eclipse can last up to 7 minutes, during which time the Moon's shadow moves across the Earth ata rate of about 6 kilometers

your brother write for you…….

while there is life ,there is hope .the underlined word is a/an .....

he has no experience , he got the job.......
….. Stop talking! I can't hear what he
questionsData.explain_answer:
Stop talking! I can't hear what he's saying.  (Sense verbs)

  • "Is saying" refers to the present moment, which wouldn't make sense since you're saying you can't hear him.
  • "Has said" refers to something that was already said in the past, but you're indicating you can't hear him right now.
  • "Said" could technically work, but "saying" is more natural-sounding in this context where you want the person to stop talking immediately.
  • "Had said" implies something completed entirely in the past, similar to "has said".
